channel.title: Help with server source
channel.description:
Okay.. I'm having a problem with every server source that ive downloaded. I've taken a break from mopar and coding for awhile and am now coming back a total noob. :( Heres the problem: - I donload a server source - Extract it to my own folder - Click run.bat - Then i get this: (have a video coming but explained below)
It will pop up for a second, like its going to work then shut off. Idk what is causing it so if you could help me it would be great!
Thanks, Driger

item.title: Help with server source
item.dc:creator: @Fireweaver0 Fireweaver0
item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

You also Need one called PATH and make the value the same as in CLASSPATH
and make sure these are in SYSTEM variables not user variabels

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server source
item.dc:creator: @driger driger
item.description:
@driger wrote:

Okay… i had a file in there named CLASSPATH and i changed it to the code you gave me and still nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server source
item.dc:creator: @Fireweaver0 Fireweaver0
item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

Lol Where you set your CLASSPATH and PATH
to get to them
Click Start > Right click my computer and click properties > Advanced > Environment Variables

you need to make Two new variables under SYSTEM Variables if they aren’t already there
And make them refer to your JDK version like so
CLASSPATH

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server source
item.dc:creator: @driger driger
item.description:
@driger wrote:

And my enviromental variables are? Sorry im like a complete nooob now.

Read full topic

Hmm it could be your environment variables
make sure your variables are correct
